content.description: Sit start with hands matched on the arete. From there, paste a high right foot, fight the barn door, slap up the arete to a good edge, then reach out to a good left hand sidepull on the face, continue slapping a right hand up the arete, gain a left hand edge, reach the lip, and mantel on top.
content.protection: A pad will work. The landing is perfect.
content.location: It climbs the west side of Gobbler's southwest arete.

content.description: Sit start with a pair of jugs. From there, work up through an assortment of generous features, bring the feet along, it will get bunched, then unfurl up towards a great rail, then negotiate an easy mantel.
content.protection: A pad or two. The landing is good.
content.location: It climbs the east face of Gobbler.

content.description: Sit start with hands matched on a great horizontal jug-edge. From there, pull to a right hand gaston, bump through it to a sloper-pinch-edge, match a left hand on it, bring the feet along, gain the lip, and mantel on top the boulder.
content.protection: A pad. The landing doesn't get any better than this.
content.location: It climbs the east face of Gobbler, just to the left of Sidecar. It does share some holds with it, but it doesn't use the arete.
